API_Description: Represents the current vertical position of the mouse cursor within the document's coordinate system.
API_Description_Reason: The property name 'mouseY' suggests it tracks the Y-coordinate of the mouse cursor, which is a common functionality in graphical interfaces.
Returns: A number representing the Y-coordinate of the mouse cursor.
Returns_Reason: Since 'mouseY' is a coordinate, it is logical to assume it returns a numerical value indicating the position of the mouse cursor along the Y-axis.

type.description: The data type of the value returned by the mouseY property.
type.description_reason: The property is expected to return a numerical value representing a coordinate.
type.type_reason: Coordinates are typically represented as numbers, indicating a position in a two-dimensional space.
